Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: disinfectant \dis`in*fect"ant\, n. That which disinfects, especially an agent for killing or removing the microorganisms which cause infection. Commonly used disinfectants are chlorine, sodium hypochlorite solution, hydrogen peroxide, and alcohol. [1913 Webster +PJC]

disinfectant adj : preventing infection by inhibiting the growth or action of microorganisms [syn: {bactericidal}, {germicidal}] n : an agent (as heat or radiation or a chemical) that destroys microorganisms that might carry disease [syn: {germicide}, {antimicrobic}, {antimicrobial}]
